verses.verse: Job <WH347> again took <WH3254> up his parable, <WH4912> and said, <WH559>
"As God <WH410> lives, <WH2416> who has taken away <WH5493> my right, <WH4941> the Almighty, <WH7706> who has made my soul <WH5315> bitter. <WH4843>

surely my lips <WH8193> shall not speak <WH1696> unrighteousness, <WH5766> neither shall my tongue <WH3956> utter <WH1897> deceit. <WH7423>
Far be it <WH2486> from me that I should justify <WH6663> you. <WH1478> Until I die I will not put away <WH5493> my integrity from me. <WH8538>
I hold <WH2388> fast to my righteousness, <WH6666> and will not let it go. <WH7503> My heart <WH3824> shall not reproach <WH2778> me so long as I live. <WH3117>
"Let my enemy <WH341> be as the wicked. <WH7563> Let him who rises up <WH6965> against me be as the unrighteous. <WH5767>
For what is the hope <WH8615> of the godless, <WH2611> when he is cut off, <WH1214> when God <WH433> takes away <WH7953> his life? <WH5315>
Will God <WH410> hear <WH8085> his cry <WH6818> when trouble <WH6869> comes on him? <WH935>
Will he delight <WH6026> himself in the Almighty, <WH7706> and call <WH7121> on God <WH433> at all times? <WH6256>
I will teach <WH3384> you about the hand <WH3027> of God. <WH410> That which is with the Almighty <WH7706> will I not conceal. <WH3582>
Behold, <WH2372> all of you have seen it yourselves; <WH1892> why then have you become altogether vain? <WH1891>
"This is the portion <WH2506> of a wicked <WH7563> man <WH120> with God, <WH410> the heritage <WH5159> of oppressors, <WH6184> which they receive <WH3947> from the Almighty. <WH7706>

Though he heap up <WH6651> silver <WH3701> as the dust, <WH6083> and prepare <WH3559> clothing <WH4403> as the clay; <WH2563>
he may prepare <WH3559> it, <WH6662> but the just shall put it on, <WH3847> and the innocent <WH5355> shall divide <WH2505> the silver. <WH3701>

He lies down <WH7901> rich, <WH6223> but he shall not do so again. <WH622> He opens <WH6491> his eyes, <WH5869> and he is not.
